DOC.brief_summary: Aim : To assess safety progression HIV infection efficacy evolution metabolic parameter body fat either viral load- CD4 cell-driven strategy intermittent treatment chronically HIV-1-infected person . Design : Pilot , prospective , open , randomize , control 3-year study . Setting patient : University hospital . Patients viral load < 200 copies/mL CD4 cell count > 450/mm3 least last 3 month . Three arm 50 patient , randomize either continue antiretroviral therapy , discontinue long either HIV-1 RNA low 30000 copies/mL CD4 cell count high 300/mm3 . Study end-points : evolution plasma metabolic parameter , body fat , bone mineral density ; incidence adverse effect due antiretroviral therapy symptom consistent acute retroviral syndrome ; incidence virological failure ( plasma HIV-1 RNA > 200 copies/mL therapy ) , immunological failure ( CD4 cell count < 200/mm3 therapy ) , clinical failure ( development AIDS-defining illness ) ; cost antiretroviral therapy administer time free therapy arm assign intermittent treatment ; evolution T lymphocyte subpopulation development proliferative cytotoxic response HIV .
